intro: Rubus fraxinifolius var. kotoensis, commonly known as Kotoensis blackberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with moist, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
